ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to understand history for the first time. Thank you professor Dean for your help.
I gained a familiarity with different approaches to writing cultural history, especially the challenges that writing cultural history presents.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was an excellent course, but one session of French history could help a lot.

This course was a nice, though not exhaustive, survey of different possible approaches to writing cultural history. I enjoyed most of the texts chosen for the course. I found at times it was difficult to find the through-line for the class, occasionally getting bogged down by the work of breaking down an entire book's structure and content each week. It would have been useful to come up with succinct summaries for each cultural historian we examined so that each approach to cultural history we observed was clear and easily compared from one cultural historian to the next.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student on the condition that a more clear mission statement be presented at the beginning of and throughout the semester. This class provides a nice sampling of cultural histories for anyone who wishes to be introduced to these kinds of materials.
